title: Real Strawberry Frosting Recipe
description: This strawberry frosting uses 4 simple ingredients, including fresh strawberries, for a gorgeous-colored, naturally flavored icing with no gelatin.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Frostings and Icings Real Strawberry Frosting 4.7 (448) 383 Reviews 141 Photos This strawberry frosting has an intense strawberry taste without using extract or gelatin. I wanted real strawberry frosting for my real strawberry cupcakes and could not find an acceptable recipe. I came up with this recipe using a strawberry purée reduction that is truly the strawberry-est. If you love strawberries, you'll love this! Submitted by Candice Updated on January 29, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 141 141 141 141 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 40 mins Servings: 18 Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe The key to this irresistible strawberry frosting is to use fresh ripe strawberries for the most delicious and natural flavor. The fresh strawberries are puréed, then reduced on the stove until the puree is thick. This results in a sturdy frosting that holds up incredibly well. Strawberry Frosting Ingredients You'll need just four easy-to-find ingredients for this sweet strawberry frosting recipe: fresh strawberries, butter, confectioners' sugar, and vanilla extract. How to Make Strawberry Frosting You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below — but here's a brief overview of what you can expect when you make homemade strawberry frosting: Purée the strawberries. Boil the strawberry purée until it's reduced by half.Beat the butter, then beat in one cup of sugar.Beat in two tablespoons of purée and the vanilla.Beat in another cup of sugar, followed by another two tablespoons of purée.Repeat until everything is blended. Recipe Tip For more intense strawberry flavor, reduce strawberry purée longer until desired intensity is reached. How to Use Strawberry Frosting Spread this strawberry frosting on your favorite strawberry cake — we recommend our top-rated Best Strawberry Cake from Scratch. It also works well with chocolate and vanilla cake. You can also use it to make cake balls or sandwich it between two cookies for a bakery-worthy treat. How to Store Strawberry Frosting Store the strawberry frosting in a shallow, airtight container in the refrigerator for up to five days. We don't recommend freezing the frosting, as it may separate and become grainy as it thaws. Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise "Now THIS is the VERY VERY BEST strawberry frosting," raves angie. "I was able to frost 22 cupcakes with some leftovers. Definitely going to keep this one." "Amazing," according to Irena. "I've made this recipe multiple times and I love how fresh and sweet the strawberries are in this buttercream. I put it on top of a chocolate cupcake, what a treat." "Loved this recipe," says Hayeskid. "Cooking the purée gave a very sweet, strong, and non-watery strawberry flavor. I'm looking forward to experimenting with other flavors using this technique." Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 18 servings 1 cup fresh strawberries 1 cup unsalted butter 3 ½ cups confectioners' sugar, sifted, divided 1 teaspoon vanilla extract Directions Place strawberries in a blender; purée until smooth. Transfer strawberry purée to a saucepan over medium heat; bring to a boil, stirring often, until reduced by at least half, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat and cool completely. Beat butter with an electric mixer in a bowl until light and fluffy. Beat in 1 cup confectioners' sugar until combined. Beat 2 tablespoons cooled strawberry purée and vanilla extract into butter mixture until just blended. Beat in 1 cup confectioners' sugar until combined, followed by 2 tablespoons strawberry purée. Repeat this step once more. Beat remaining 1/2 cup confectioners' sugar into mixture until just blended. I Made It Print 826 home cooks made it! If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Real Strawberry Frosting 01 of 141 Photo by  Jennifer Baker 02 of 141 Photo by  ZanyThyme1616 06/21/2022 03 of 141 Photo by  Chef Aly 08/07/2021 04 of 141 Photo by  Heather 03/13/2021 05 of 141 Photo by  Tess Johnston 02/15/2021 I’ve never written a review for a recipe, but I had to write one for this. My brother absolutely hates frosting and has never found one he likes; he avoids frosting, scooping it off and eats the cake. For this however, he ate the frosting FIRST. He said it was the best frosting he’s ever had. Like others have said, reduction is the key to a solid frosting. I would compare the taste to Häagen-Dazs strawberry ice cream. 06 of 141 Photo by  Marley Medina 01/18/2021 07 of 141 Photo by  crhagen 12/30/2020 08 of 141 Photo by  ccolborn 09/07/2020 Very good! Easy to make ! I’ll definitely be making this again. Thanks for sharing! 09 of 141 Photo by  Heidi Degenkolb 09/07/2020 10 of 141 Photo by  moka 09/05/2020 Delicious! I used 1 1/2 cups of frozen strawberries and thawed them overnight in the refrigerator. After blending them smooth, I reduced them on the stove for at least 30 minutes. I put in 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract and 1/2 teaspoon almond extract instead of the full teaspoon of vanilla, and I included a pinch of salt. I did put in the final 1/2 cup of powdered sugar. This recipe was just barely enough for one dozen cupcakes. I might make more next time to ensure I have enough. Great recipe! I used this buttercream to top white chocolate-vanilla cupcakes for my daughter’s first birthday! 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Strawberries and Cream Buttercream 2 Ratings Strawberry Buttercream Frosting 3 Ratings Easy Strawberry Cream Cheese Frosting 17 Ratings Strawberry-Chocolate Mini Cupcakes with White Chocolate Ganache 6 Ratings Strawberry Cream Cheese Frosting 4 Ratings Strawberry (Jam!) name: Candice
instructions: Purée the strawberries. Boil the strawberry purée until it's reduced by half.;Beat the butter, then beat in one cup of sugar.;Beat in two tablespoons of purée and the vanilla.;Beat in another cup of sugar, followed by another two tablespoons of purée.;Repeat until everything is blended.;Place strawberries in a blender; purée until smooth.;Transfer strawberry purée to a saucepan over medium heat; bring to a boil, stirring often, until reduced by at least half, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat and cool completely.;Beat butter with an electric mixer in a bowl until light and fluffy. Beat in 1 cup confectioners' sugar until combined. Beat 2 tablespoons cooled strawberry purée and vanilla extract into butter mixture until just blended.;Beat in 1 cup confectioners' sugar until combined, followed by 2 tablespoons strawberry purée. Repeat this step once more.;Beat remaining 1/2 cup confectioners' sugar into mixture until just blended.
